intro: Rottlera oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leafed rottlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite in arrangement, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which also includes cashew and poison ivy.
